title: Mortgage Consumer Direct Lender
description:
Pay is based on a number of factors including the successful candidate’s job-related knowledge and skills, qualifications, and prior experience. Arvest offers a comprehensive suite of benefits, including a full range of health and life, financial, and wellness benefits. For more information about benefits, please visit www.arvest.com/careers/benefits .

Position is Monday through Friday 8 am to 5 pm with ability to work additional hours as needed.

Location: 7300 College Blvd, Overland Park, KS.

2 Years Of Mortgage Origination Experience Preferred.

Summary:

 The story of Arvest is one of commitment started by our founders in 1961, with an intense dedication to focusing on our customers. We will always be active and involved members of the communities we serve, and we will always work to put the needs of our customers first as we continue to fulfill our mission – People helping people find financial solutions for life. 

 Job Title: Mortgage Consumer Direct Lender 

The Mortgage Consumer Direct Lender offers professional guidance to customers during their search for financing and offers expert advice on products for 1-4 family residential loans. The incumbent is responsible for proactively calling or responding to an array of customer contact initiatives; telephone inquiries, Arvest website, Arvest app, call campaigns and following up on leads and referrals to generate sales of residential mortgage loans. The incumbent will maximize the generation of revenue in a fast-paced environment utilizing all cross-selling opportunities. The Mortgage Consumer Direct Lender will minimize risk exposure by adhering to all federal, state and internal compliance regulations, policies and procedures. Ensures that all customers, both internal and external, are responded to in a timely manner while adhering to the Arvest Sundown Rule

We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.

 What You’ll Do at Arvest:  (Other duties may be assigned.)


 Proactively contact potential customers through various channels; accept and make multiple sales calls daily (inbound and outbound) utilizing interpersonal and communication skills to generate mortgage applications through lead sources. Provide a comprehensive picture of the full features and benefits of mortgage products and do so in a manner that is most relevant to the customer. Sell the most relevant benefits in a positive, persuasive manner to each customer. Review the Arvest lead management system for leads of applicants, initiate contact and respond to any questions that may arise. Take applications over the phone, the Arvest website or the Arvest app and collect required financial/mortgage information. Analyze detailed financial and credit data; matching customer needs with an appropriate loan program and level of risk. Recommend differing products based on customers’ needs and circumstances. Maintain a current knowledge base of the mortgage industry, mortgage products, lending practices and regulatory guidelines. Know and follow the Arvest lending policy, procedures and underwriting requirements. Be cognizant of opportunities to exceed customer expectations by actively listening to the customer and making referrals when applicable. Build rapport and leverage customer relationships by meeting and exceeding their needs. Resolve all customer complaints personally or refer them to the appropriate area. Forward a copy of all written complaints to manager for additional follow-up, if necessary. Build “customer for life” relationships by providing routine and structured follow-up to ensure that each customer will always look to Arvest for future mortgage transactions. Ask for referral opportunities from existing customers in an effort to advance the scope and reach of our existing customer base and to exceed department sales goals and personal goals. Understand and comply with bank policy, laws, regulations, and the bank's BSA/AML Program, as applicable to your job duties. This includes but is not limited to; complete compliance training and adhere to internal procedures and controls; report any known violations of compliance policy, laws, or regulations and report any suspicious customer and/or account activity.


Responsibilities:

 Toolbox for Success: 


 High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) required. 1 year of sales experience required. 1 year of mortgage/real estate experience required. Current NMLS SAFE Act Registration or the ability to be registered within 30 days required. Associates Degree or equivalent related experience preferred. Relevant military experience considered for veterans and transitioning service members.


 Physical Demands: 

The associate must be able to travel occasionally by themselves within the US, possibly overnight. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

We offer competitive compensation, benefits packages, and significant professional growth.

 Along with an excellent benefits package, our associates are engaged, rewarded for performance, and encouraged to grow professionally and personally. Our future is driven by our associates. If you want to be recognized for your results and empowered to reach your potential, we urge you to apply. 

Grade 13

Pay Range: $21.36 - $25.37 per hour

title: Social Media Manager
description:
We are hiring a Social Media Manager in your area!

As a Social Media Manager, you’ll be responsible for creating, curating, and managing content across various social media platforms, including Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook. Your goal will be to enhance brand visibility, engage with the audience, and drive traffic to our online presence.

Benefits: 

 Competitive salary  Direct Deposit every Friday  Performance Bonus  Company Profit Sharing Bonus  Safety Bonus  Company provided cell phone, vehicle and gas card  8 paid federal holidays  Paid Vacation  Excellent Medical, Dental, and Vision (HSA and FSA Spending Accounts)  401k match, Paid Time Off, Employee Discounts  Company Paid and voluntary Life and AD& D, Short- and Long-Term Disability 

 ConServ Building Services was founded in 1991, as the service division of BCH Mechanical. We began dispatching HVAC techs in the Tampa Bay, FL area and in just a short time, ConServ’s reputation for customer service and technical expertise began to grow in GA, SC, NC, VA, TN, MS and AL. We are the number one choice for regional clients with multiple accounts, convenience stores, and those who prefer remote monitoring and control.

What you will be doing: 

 Content Creation and Curation:  Develop engaging and relevant content for Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook.  Curate user-generated content and share it strategically.  Platform Management:  Maintain a consistent posting schedule on all platforms.  Monitor comments, messages, and mentions, responding promptly and professionally.  Optimize profiles and ensure brand consistency.  Audience Engagement:  Foster meaningful interactions with followers.  Run contests, polls, and Q&A sessions to engage the audience.  Encourage user-generated content and community participation.  Analytics and Reporting:  Track key performance metrics (likes, shares, followers, etc.).  Analyze data to refine strategies and improve reach.  Prepare regular reports for management.  Campaigns and Advertising:  Plan and execute social media campaigns.  Collaborate with marketing teams to align social media efforts with overall brand campaigns.  Manage paid advertising on platforms like Facebook Ads. Stay Updated:  Keep up with social media trends, algorithm changes, and emerging platforms.  Explore new features and tools to enhance our social media presence. 

 What you need for this role:

 Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.  Proven experience managing social media accounts (Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook). 

Additional Responsibility: Social Media Recruiting 

 Recruitment Campaigns: Leverage social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook) to attract potential candidates.  Create compelling content highlighting job openings, company culture, and employee testimonials.  Engage with followers who express interest in job opportunities.  Talent Pipelining: Build and nurture relationships with passive candidates through social media channels.  Identify and connect with industry professionals, influencers, and potential hires.  Employer Branding: Showcase our organization as an attractive employer.  Share behind-the-scenes glimpses, success stories, and employee spotlights.  Analytics for Recruitment: Monitor recruitment-related metrics (e.g., applications received via social media).  Adjust strategies based on data insights.  

 Interested in joining the team? 

 Check us out at conservonline.com/careers 

We strive to foster a work environment that includes and embraces racial, ethnic and gender diversity and other individual differences. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion helps us attract and retain the best talent, enables employees to realize their full potential, and drives high performance through innovation and collaboration.

title: Sales Counselor
description:
Overview

Rogue Valley Manor, is proud to be Southern Oregon’s premier not-for-profit Life Plan Community. The Manor is a

thriving, bustling village of nearly 1,000 incredible residents, with a sprawling, magnificent 668-acre campus that’s full of

active, engaging ways for residents to spend their time. Our campus offers residents delicious dining and a continuum of

healthcare including Assisted Living, Memory Care and Skilled Nursing. 

We are currently seeking an experienced and compassionate Sales Counselor to help in building relationships with qualified prospective residents, helping to guide them through the sales process, find creative ways to overcome objections through mutual discovery and lead prospective residents to secure residency in the community. 

Apply today and learn why The Rogue Valley Manor has consistently been ranked as one of Southern Oregon’s top senior

living communities!

What you'll be doing:

Manage the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database by streamlining documentation, forms, applicant lists, procedures and processes to ensure that the marketing department is operating as efficiently as possible.Assist prospects and residents with documents throughout the move-in and move-out process, coordinating efforts and creating and providing notices with all associated departments including facilities, administration, resident services, dining services and marketing department.Build Independent Living Brochures, apartment floor plans, Move-In Guides, new resident files, and other materials essential to the sales process.Produce routine reporting that empowers sales activities and provides valuable information about customer preferences and objections. Complete market research and competitive analysis on a quarterly basis.Assist with general community inquiries by providing basic information and conducting introductory tours of the community as the first step in the sales process.Prequalify prospects and follow through until they are able to be assigned to a Sales Counselor. Utilize CRM software to enter and schedule marketing leads as needed.Create, update and maintain Applicant List, Wait List and depositor files.Schedule activities and follow-up communication to prospects and residents after tours and events, recording the communication in RHS.Attend mandatory in-service meetings and complete Relias classes as scheduled.Be aware of changes in health and safety regulation and changes in employee policies and emergency procedures.Shadow the Sales and Marketing Director and Sales Counselor(s) to learn the core functions of those roles as they relate to the overall sales process and your responsibilities.Ensure required documentation is accurate and complete throughout the sales and move-in process.

Pay: $23.00 hr - $ 25.00 hr / DOE

About You:

Minimum of 1 year's experience in sales or a related field.Bachelor’s degree in business, communication, marketing or related field is preferred.Ability to continuously balance competing priorities while providing exemplary customer service.Computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office programs, customer relationship management software and social media platforms.

Working at Rogue Valley Manor, you will enjoy the following benefits: 

Career-centered opportunity for advancementPayActive (early wage access)FREE Employee ParkingMedical, Dental, Vision & Perscription Benefits we pay 90% of employee's monthly premium we pay 50% of dependents(s) monthly premium4% 401(K) match (after one-year/1000 hours)Defined Contribution Retirement planFlexible Spending Plan (up to $2750 per plan year, Dependent Care $5000)Generous PTO (paid time off) planEmployee Recognition programsEducation Tuition Assistance Programs and Employee DevelopmentEmployee Refferal Bonus ProgramEmployee access to onsite pool & gym

Apply today and learn why The Rogue Valley Manor has consistently been ranked as one of Southern Oregon’s top senior

living communities!

title: Culinary - Purchaser/Receiver
description:
Organization- Chicago Athletic Association

Summary

At Chicago Athletic Association, we believe our guests select us because of our caring and attentive associates who are focused on providing efficient service and meaningful experiences.

The Culinary Purchaser/Receiver is a vital role in the purchasing and receiving department., ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of inventory management and control. They must communicate with the Chef and ops teams daily on product usage and pars. The primary responsibilities are to receive, inspect, and verify all incoming shipments, maintaining accurate records and ensuring the organization and sanitation of receiving areas and storage rooms.

 We Offer Excellent Benefits: 

 Free room nights, Discounted and Friends & Family Room Rates  Medical, Prescription, Dental and Vision Insurance in 30-days 401K with company match  Paid Vacation, sick days, new child leave and personal day  Paid Family Bonding Time and Adoption Assistance  Tuition and Fitness Reimbursement  Free colleague meals during shift  Employee Stock Purchase plan  Complimentary access to Headspace, Working Advantage platform and discounts at various retailers, both online or in stores.

 COVID- 19 Safety: 

Hyatt Hotels follows all COVID-19 CDC and Cook County Health department protocols for the safety of our employees and guests.

 Hyatt is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. 

Key Responsibilities include:

 Accurately check in, puts away, and sign for all accounted product.  Separate orders by kitchen areas; moving, handling, and transporting product to each department carefully and accurately.  Have a thorough understanding of the necessary systems and programs needed to perform key job responsibilities ie. Birchstreet.  Work and regularly communicate directly with ops teams to ensure purchasing, receiving, and storing methods are accurate. Match received items with corresponding invoices and codes for accounting purposes.  Communicate any discrepancies, shortages, and price fluctuations to Supervisor. Maintain cleanliness and organization of receiving areas and storage rooms. Keep track and help manage inventory levels, minimizing dead stock items and ensuring profitability through efficient inventory control.  Inspect and verify the quality and condition of all product and returns product if conditions are not met. Accurately complete all necessary paperwork and updates inventory and order lists when needed. Assist ops teams with sourcing product, placing orders, and setting up and updating catalogs within Birchstreet.  Must be able to lift up to 50lbs. Understands and prepares for the physical demands of moving around product the majority of the shift and follows proper lifting guidelines to ensure safe moving and placement of product. 

Qualifications

 Strong attention to detail and accuracy.  Excellent organizational skill and time management.  Possess strong leadership, communication, organization and relationship skills.  Proficient in general computer skills.  Ability to communicate effectively with team members and management.  High school diploma or equivalent.  Physical ability to lift and move heavy items and stand for extended periods.  Previous experience in a receiving or inventory management role preferred.

title: Cost Estimator
description:
KTS

Job ID 2455022

Koniag Technology Solutions, a Koniag Government Services company, is seeking a Cost Estimator with a Top- Secret Clearance to support KTS and our government customer in Washington, DC.

We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.

Koniag Technology Solutions, LLC is seeking a Cost Estimator in Washington, DC to act as primary contact between our office and the Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI) The Cost Estimator will have essential multi- discipline team representation and be self-motivated, well organized, design oriented, and customer focused.

Responsibilities:

Generate consistent and accurate pricing, ability to develop accurate conceptual cost models.Understanding construction methods, productivity, equipment, systems, and materials.Keep track of current material & labor pricing including escalation.Maintain relationships with subcontractors & material vendors.Make meaningful value engineering contributions.Ability to reconcile estimates with other consultants & design team.Serves as “Job Captain” for pre-construction efforts.Quantity take-off and pricing accuracy.Strategic Bid Preparation to include efficient strategies and competitive pricing.Preparing technical narratives.Complete subcontractor/vendor solicitation.Understand and analyze proposal specifications, drawings, attend pre-bid meetings to determine scope of work and required contents of estimate as well as code related compliance.Prepare bid packages and create scopes of work.Conduct detailed review of bids for scope gaps and ensure adherence to plans and specifications.Track awarded contracts as required to include estimating/pricing extra work items, change orders, credits, procuring materials, assist in development of project preplan.Expand database of subcontractors and suppliers.Develop, improve, and maintain in-house procedures for the estimating department.

Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

5+ years of experience in estimating, cost control, and/or engineering (at least six years estimating experience) in commercial construction within all divisions. projects having estimated costs ranging from $100,000 to $15,000,000.Estimating experience from conceptual through construction document phases required.Knowledge of estimating software such as Timberline, Cost Works, RS Means, MCACE, or others.4-year degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Civil Engineering, Construction management, Architectural Engineering or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.Technical knowledge of various mechanical and electrical systems as well as experience in all structural/architectural disciplines and code and regulatory compliance.Top Secret Security Clearance.

Working Environment & Conditions

This job operates in a professional office environment and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

This position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand, walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The workload may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, do simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress.

The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
